title: Kelvin Walkway Route

images.title: Richard Webb / River Kelvin Walkway, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Path beside the river near the Belmont Bridge.

images.title: Thomas Nugent / Kelvin Walkway, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: With the old North Woodside flint mill lade in the foreground.

images.title: Lairich Rig / Looking north along the Kelvin Walkway, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking north along the Kelvin Walkway After another 500 metres or so, the Allander Walkway branches off to the east, leading to Milngavie.

images.title: Jim Barton / Beneath Kelvin Bridge, Glasgow, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Beneath Kelvin Bridge

images.title: Carol Walker / Bridge over the River Kelvin, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bridge over the River Kelvin The Botanical Gardens form part of the Kelvin Walkway. It is approximately a 40 minute walk to the City centre.

images.title: Thomas Nugent / North Woodside flint mill, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: North Woodside flint mill. The remains of the mill by the River Kelvin in the west end of Glasgow. Kelvin Stevenson Memorial Church is visible in the background.

images.title: Raymond Okonski / Katrine Aqueduct at Balmuildy Bridge
images.caption: Katrine Aqueduct at Balmuildy Bridge. Balmuildy road bridge (A 879) is on the right, and 4 large bore pipes cross the River Kelvin carrying water from Loch Katrine to Glasgow. The bridge on the left is a pedestrian route for the Kelvin Walkway, and uses a central support for the aqueduct to provide stability. The remaining two aqueduct pipes are to the left.

images.title: Thomas Nugent / North Woodside flint mill
images.caption: North Woodside flint mill. The remains of the mill by the River Kelvin in the west end of Glasgow. Kelvin Stevenson Memorial Church is visible in the background.

description: This walk follows the River Kelvin from Milngavie to the Glasgow Heliport on the River Clyde. The walk was created to form a 'green link' from the countryside to the parks, museums, galleries and historical/cultural landmarks in Glasgow. The walk runs through Kelvinside, Kelvingrove Park and Yorkhill with fine views of Glasgow University. The walk links with the Forth and Clyde Canal at the Kelvin Aqueduct so you could enjoy a canalside stroll here too. At the start of the route there are nice walks to be found around Milngavie Reservoir and Mugdock Country Park .
